options.caption: Save data path
options.description:
Define where Kirikiri should save all types of data.

There are some special strings which can be embedded in the definition string.

'$(exepath)' will be replaced by System.exePath

'$(appdatapath)' will be replaced by System.appDataPath

$'(personalpath)' will be replaced by System.personalPath

'$(vistapath)' will be replaced by '$(appdatapath)' in OS higher than Vista, and by '$(exepath)' in OS lower than Vista.

Value of this property can be obtained by 'System.dataPath'
options.name: datapath

options.caption: Process wait
options.description:
Define if the engine should limit and reduce CPU usage on transition scenes by inserting a wait in processing.

'Do not wait': CPU usage can surge to 100% on transition scenes.

Otherwise processing will execute at a set frequency between 12-120(Hz). CPU usage can be reduced by setting to a lower frequency, but execution may appear disrupted. This setting may not work on some systems.

When'V-sync' is set to 'Use V-sync' in graphics section, this setting will be ignored.
options.name: contfreq

options.caption: Memory usage
options.description:
Set memory usage.

The 'Low' option will save more memory compared to 'Normal', but performance will be affected. When 'Low' is selected, 'Graphics cache limit' will be treated as 'No caching'.
options.name: memusage

options.caption: Timer accuracy
options.description:
Set timer accuracy.

Execuion mighy be improved, but performance can be affected. This setting only applies to NT OS (NT/2000/XP/Vista and higher).
options.name: timerprec

options.caption: Timer event tolerance limit
options.description:
Set if the engine should limit the tolerance of timer events.

If enabled, some user control issues caused by slow computers not being able to match the processing speed can sometimes by solved.
options.name: laxtimer

options.caption: Low priority
options.description:
Set if priority is lowered during transition scenes. 

Enabling may fix skipping sound issues.
options.name: lowpri

options.caption: Startup script
options.description: Define the first script loaded on startup.
options.name: startup

options.caption: Text editor to run during exceptions
options.description: Set text editor to open when exceptions are thrown.
options.name: exceptionexe

options.caption: Text editor launch arguments
options.description:
Define launch arguments for text editor when exceptions are thrown.

%filepath% is the file path, %line% is the line number.
options.name: exceptionarg

options.caption: Enable LFH
options.description:
Enable LFH to prevent memory fragmentation.

Inefficient memory errors can sometimes be solved by enabling this option. This option is enabled regardless of user choice in Vista or later.
options.name: uselfh

options.caption: Enable process CRT heap compaction
options.description:
Compress process CRT heap during garbage collection.

This may stop  inefficient memory errors from occurring constantly, but compaction will take some time.
options.name: ghcompact

options.caption: Mouse wheel detection
options.description:
Set how mouse wheel input is detected.

Disabled: Disable mouse wheel input.

DirectInput: Use DirectInput for detection.

Window Message: Do not use DirectInput for detection.

Mouse wheel related issues can sometimes be solved by changing this setting.
options.name: wheel

options.caption: Enable joystick input
options.description:
Enable or disable joystick input. 

Joystick will be disabled if set to 'Disabled'. If the joystick cannot be detected or does not function properly, set this value to 'Disabled'.
options.name: joypad

options.caption: Joystick key repeat delay
options.description: Define joystick key repeat delay by milliseconds.
options.name: paddelay

options.caption: Joystick key repeat interval
options.description: Define joystick key repeat interval by milliseconds. The smaller the value, the faster the repeated input.
options.name: padinterval

options.caption: Enable input method control
options.description:
Set if the engine should control state of input methods.

Disabling may help solve problems related to input of Japanese and other languages.
options.name: controlime

options.caption: PCM decode thread priority
options.description:
Priority of PCM decode thread.

Raise priority when skipping sound occurs during playback.
options.name: wsdecpri

options.caption: DirectSound software mixing
options.description:
Set if the engine should use DirectSound for software mixing.

 Skipping sound issues can sometimes be solved by changing this setting.
options.name: wssoft

options.caption: DirectSound secondary buffer rebuild
options.description:
Set if the engine should rebuild DirectSound secondary buffer constantly.

Skipping sound at the beginning of playback can sometimes be solved by adjusting this setting.
options.name: wsrecreate

options.caption: DirectSound secondary buffer length
options.description:
Define the length of DirectSound secondary buffer.

Playback is more stable with a longer buffer, but it also consumes more memory.
options.name: wsl1len

options.caption: DirectSound secondary auxiliary buffer length
options.description:
Define the length of DirectSound secondary auxiliary buffer.

Playback is more stable with a longer buffer, but it also consumes more memory.
options.name: wsl2len

options.caption: DirectSound mute
options.description:
Define if DirectSound should mute (lower the volume) when the application becomes inactive or minimized.

'Never mute' will not mute the application.

'Mute when minized' and 'Mute when inactive' will mute the application in coresponding conditions.
options.name: wsmute

options.caption: DirectSound mute volume
options.description:
Set mute volume for 'DirectSound mute'

Set to '0%' for complete mute, '50%' for around half of the full volume (around -6dB)
options.name: wsmutevol

options.caption: DirectSound forced format conversion
options.description:
Set if the engine should forcibly convert PCM data played by DirectSound to a defined format.

Playback issues can sometimes be solved by adjusting this setting.

Choosing '16bit integer monaural' will make the engine ignore 'DirectSound forced 4ch playback'.
options.name: wsforcecnv

options.caption: DirectSound 3D control
options.description:
Set if the engine should use DirectSound for 3D control.

This will enable 3D control of sound in some applications. In most cases stereo and monaural sound will be extended to surrounding speakers. The engine will ignore 'DirectSound forced 4ch playback' if enabled.
options.name: wsuse3d

options.caption: DirectSound forced 4ch playback
options.description:
Set if the engine should force 4ch playback including rear speakers when playing stereo or monaural sound with DirectSound.

Choosing 'Yes' will allow front and rear speakers to play stereo and monaural sound if sound was not played previously.
options.name: wsexpandquad

options.caption: DirectSound primary buffer frequency
options.description:
Set frequency of DirectSound primary buffer.

In some cases playback will manifest some change.
options.name: wsfreq

options.caption: DirectSound primary buffer bit length
options.description:
Set playback bit length of DirectSound primary buffer.

In some cases playback will not change by ajusting this setting.
options.name: wsbits

options.caption: DirectSound primary buffer playback control
options.description:
Set if the engine should control playback of DirectSound primary buffer buffer.

Adjust this setting can sometimes solve skipping sound issues.
options.name: wscontrolpri

options.caption: DirectSound primary buffer attempt level
options.description:
Set how many combinations of format configurations to try when defining DirectSound primary buffer.

Level 0: Try stereo 16-bit integer.

Level 1: Try channels defined by system speaker settings, 16-bit integer before trying level 0.

Level 2: Try bit-length defined by 'DirectSound primary buffer bit-length' and channels defined by system speaker settings as a WAVEFORMATEX struct, before trying level 1.

All: Try the same values in level 2 as a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE struct before trying level 2.
options.name: wspritry

options.caption: Graphics cache limit
options.description:
Define maximum memory for which the graphics cache can use.

If swap occurs constantly, 'No caching' can sometimes solve the problem.
options.name: gclim

options.caption: Fullscreen mode resolution
options.description:
Set resolution of fullscreen mode.

Auto: Use the most optimal resolution. In this case use a resolution defined in the application with the same aspect ratio as the current one if such option exists. Otherwise the engine will scretch the image. Even if 'Scale image by engine in fullscreen mode' is set to 'Disabled', this setting is treated as 'Fit in screen'.

Keep apect ratio: Use the closest resolution that has the same aspect ratio as in window mode.

Closest resolution: Use the closest resolution defined in the application but its aspect ratio is not guranteed to be identical to window mode. This option works for CRT monitors and some LCD panels that support scaled display while keeping aspect issue.

No change: Resolution will remain the same as in window mode.
options.name: fsres

options.caption: Scale image by engine in fullscreen mode
options.description:
Set how the engine should scale image in fullscreen mode.

Fit in monitor: Scale the image to fit in the monitor. Black gaps may appear in this case.

Fill in monitor: Stretch the image to aviod showing any gaps. Parts of the image can sometimes be outside of display range

No scaling: The engine will not scale any image.

When 'Fullscreen mode resolution' is set to 'Auto', this setting is treated as 'Fit in monitor' even if 'No scaling' is selected.
options.name: fszoom

options.caption: Divided processing of graphics rendering
options.description:
Set if the engine should divide and process graphics rendering.

Adjusting this setting can sometimes stop the screen from blinking, but rendering performance can be affected.

If 'Double buffering' is enabled, set to options other than 'Disabled' here.
options.name: gsplit

options.caption: Scaled display smoothing
options.description:
Set if smoothing is applied when scaling the display.

'Smoothing' refers to smoothed scaling when image is scaled according to settings of 'Fullscreen mode resolution'. When disabled, 'Double buffering' is treated as 'Use GDI'.
options.name: smoothzoom

options.caption: Anti-aliasing text rendering
options.description:
Settings of anti-aliasing text rendering.

Adjusting this setting can sometimes solve issues of text not being displayed or not properly rendered. 

Resampling(4x4) is faster than resampling(8x8), but less accurate.
options.name: aamethod

options.caption: JPEG decode accuracy
options.description:
Set the accuracy of JPEG image decoding (decompressing).

High: High accuracy but decoding is slower.

Low: Low accuracy but decoding is faster.
options.name: jpegdec

options.caption: Graphics rendering thread count
options.description:
Set thread count of graphics rendering.

Rendering performance on multi-core systems can be improved by setting multiple rendering threads, but performance can also be worse in some cases.
options.name: drawthread

options.caption: Bitmap memory allocation
options.description:
Set how the engine should allocate memory for bitmap.

Process heap normally works fine.
options.name: bitmapallocator

options.caption: Initial heap size
options.description: Set initial heap size when using separate heaps when allocating memory for bitmap.
options.name: bitmapheapsize

options.caption: MMX
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpummx

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: 3DNow!
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpu3dn

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: CMOVcc
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpucmov

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: Enhanced 3DNow!
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpue3dn

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: EMMX (MMX2)
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpuemmx

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE2
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse2

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE3
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse3

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSSE3
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpussse3

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE4.1
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse41

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE4.2
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse42

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: SSE4a
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpusse4a

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: AVX
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpuavx

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: AVX2
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpuavx2

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: FMA3
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpufma3

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: AES
options.description: Adjust this setting when CPU cannot be detected properly.
options.name: cpuaes

values.desc: Do not use even if available

options.caption: Core limit
options.description: Adjust this setting when something goes wrong
options.name: cpucorelimit

options.caption: Debug mode
options.description:
Set if debug mode is enabled.

Some auxiliary functions are available in debug mode of Kirikiri, but execution will become slower.
options.name: debug

options.caption: Write log to file
options.description:
Set if the engine should write console log to a file.

Enabled: Append log to the log file.

Clear: Clear the log file before writing new log.
options.name: forcelog

options.caption: Write log to file when error occurs
options.description:
Set if the engine should write console log to a file automatically when an error occurs.

Enabled: Append log to the log file.

Clear: Clear the log file before writing new log.
options.name: logerror

options.caption: Register to ROT table
options.description: Set if the engine should register to ROT(Running Object Table) during video playback.If enabled, the engine can use GraphEdit included in DirectX SDK for troubleshooting video playback issues. 'Pause' means pause and present a message box after the graph is plotted.
options.name: movie_reg_rot

options.caption: Archive delimiter
options.description:
Set the delimiter used in archive names and storage in archives.

Since 2.19 beta 14, the default symbol has been changed from '#' to '>'. If the application is expceted to run on version earlier than 2.19 beta 14, it may not work if delimiter it not set to '#'.
options.name: arcdelim

options.caption: Behavior of post-operator '!'
options.description:
Set the behavior of post-operator '!' (eval).

In TJS2 post-operator '!' is evaluated on global context, while it is evaluated on 'this' context since 2.21 beta 9. If the application is expected to run on version lower than 2.21 beta 9, it may not work if this setting is not set to 'Evaluate on global'.
options.name: evalcontext

options.caption: Default value of Layer.holdAlpha
options.description:
Set default value of Layer.holdAlpha property (Protect alpha value or not).

If the application if excepted to run on version lower than 2.23 beta 5, it may not work it this setting is not set to 'True'.
options.name: holdalpha

options.caption: Behavior of pre-operator '*'
options.description:
Set the behavior of pre-operator '*' (Bypass property access).

In TJS2 pre-operator '*' can provide access to a property object without using property handler. Since 2.25 beta 1, this functionality is assigned to pre-operator'&', while pre-oprerator '*' will call property handler when accessing a property object. If the application is expected to run on version lower than 2.25 beta 1, it may not work if this setting is not 'Compatible with lower than 2.25'.
options.name: unaryaster

options.caption: DirectSound volume curve
options.description:
DirectSound volume curve.

Volume sound curve of DirectSound became more intuitive after 2.31 2011/6/14.
options.name: dsvolfactor

options.caption: Script encoding
options.description: Script encoding when reading from files.
options.name: readencoding

options.caption: Disable touch pad
options.description: Disable touch events and trigger mouse events instead.
options.name: ignoretouch

options.caption: Disable file property
options.description: Disable file property, treat files with 'prop' extension as a normal file.
options.name: ignorefileprop
